title: Blue Skies Aviation Solutions donates Rs. 5 million worth of lubricants to support relief missions
byline: Blue Skies Aviation Solutions (Pvt) Ltd, one of Sri Lanka’s leading aviation service providers, has extended vital support to national relief efforts by donating aviation lubricants worth Rs. 5 million to the Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF).

title: Thai PM dissolves parliament to ’return power to people’
byline: Thailand has dissolved parliament after nearly a week of fresh clashes along its border with Cambodia, with a general election to be called within 45 to 60 days.

title: Snoop Dogg named US ’honorary coach’ for Winter Olympics
byline: American rapper Snoop Dogg has been named an ’honorary coach’ for Team USA at next year’s Winter Olympics.

title: World Cup ticket prices 'monumental betrayal' say fans’ group
byline: Supporters hoping to attend next year’s World Cup final face paying thousands of pounds for the cheapest ticket.

title: Magnitude 6.7 earthquake hits Japan’s northeast, tsunami warning issued
byline: An earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 6.7 has hit Japan’s northeastern region, prompting a tsunami advisory from the Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA).

title: SEC defers Colombo Dockyard suspension as India’s  Mazagon Dock set for takeover
byline: Colombo Dockyard PLC (CDL) has secured a critical six-month extension on the trading of its shares, averting an immediate suspension as it finalises a strategic takeover by India’s Mazagon Dock

title: Sri Lanka’s apparel sector must focus on differentiation over volume: SLAEA Chief
byline: Sri Lanka needs to be proactive over changing global regulatory environments such as the European Union’s (EU) Directive on Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence (CSDDD) and its Forced Labour

title: Rs. 5,000 one-time nutrition allowance for pregnant mothers
byline: In view of the prevailing disaster situation and the upcoming festive season, arrangements have been made to provide a nutrition allowance of Rs. 5,000 to pregnant mothers, the Ministry of Women and Child Affairs said.

title: Police request for Ashoka Ranwala’s alcohol test following accident
byline: Police said today that medical reports for the drivers, including former Speaker and MP Ashoka Ranwala, involved in the accident in Sapugaskanda last night, have been requested to determine whether they were under the influence of alcohol.

title: 997 arrested in ‘Ratam Ekata’ operation
byline: Nearly 1,000 anti-drug operations were conducted across the country yesterday under the ‘Ratam Ekata’ nationwide crackdown, police said.

title: Sri Lanka’s traditional Kithul tapping added to UNESCO’s Intangible Cultural Heritage list
byline: Sri Lanka’s traditional practice of Kithul Madeema/Kithul Kapeema, an ancient indigenous technology for extracting sap from the Kithul (Caryota urens), has been inscribed on the UNESCO Representative List of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity.

title: Avoid trips and picnics due to dangerous weather: NBRO
byline: Senior Geologist at the National Building Research Organization (NBRO), Dr. Wasantha Senadheera, warned the public to avoid trips and picnics as the country remains in a dangerous situation due to the prevailing extreme weather.

title: Grade 12 GIT exam rescheduled for January 11
byline: The General Information and Technology (GIT) examination for Grade 12 students has been rescheduled to January 11, 2026, the Examinations Department announced today.

title: Bulgarian government resigns after mass protests
byline: Bulgaria’s government has resigned following weeks of street protests against its economic policies and its perceived failure to tackle corruption.

title: 34 major reservoirs still overflowing, water levels rise in several rivers
byline: As of today, 34 major reservoirs in the country are still overflowing, with the capacity of major and medium-sized reservoirs under the Irrigation Department reaching around 80%, Irrigation Director (Hydrology and Disaster Management) Engineer L.S. Suriyabandara said.

title: Finance Ministry revises excise fees
byline: The government has moved to overhaul excise licensing charges, with the Finance Ministry issuing Excise Notification No. 03/2025 to introduce a revised fee structure.

title: Sri Lankans have the highest IQ in South Asia
byline: As of 2025, Sri Lankans have the highest average IQ levels in South Asia with an average IQ level of 102, which has also been ranked in the top 12 countries with the highest average IQ level in the world, according to the data from International IQ Test (IIT).

title: Sri Lanka’s upcountry geography altered by cyclone Ditwah
byline: Sri Lanka’s upcountry geography has changed in certain areas due to landslides triggered by cyclone Ditwah, warranting revision of the land-use map series in view of several areas severely, Surveyor General N.K.U. Rohana said.

title: Thousands of lives saved as people evacuated well in advance: Minister
byline: Amidst claims of the opposition that the government failed to act on prior warnings on the disaster situation, Cabinet Spokesman Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said yesterday people in landslide prone areas were warned well in advance to evacuate by the Disaster Management Centre (DMC), police and security forces, based on forecast of the Meteorology Department, which saved thousands of lives.

title: Night-time travel to Nuwara Eliya discouraged due to landslide risk
byline: Nuwara Eliya District Secretary Thushari Tennakoon urged motorists to avoid travelling on any road leading to Nuwara Eliya during night-time due to the heightened risk of landslides.

title: Suspect arrested over Rs. 6.8 Mn online fraud
byline: A 31-year-old resident of Welipenna was arrested by the Cyber Crimes Investigation Division over a large-scale online fraud.

title: Call for dialogue with all relevant parties on Universities Amendment Bill: Sajith
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa today urged the government to call for a dialogue with all relevant parties on the proposed Universities Amendment Bill which has already been tabled in Parliament.

title: Devindya Oshini becomes first Sri Lankan to reach No. 1 in World Chess Rankings
byline: Sri Lanka’s rising chess star, W.I.M. Devindya Oshini Gunawardhana, has made history by climbing to World No. 1 in the Under-13 Girls’ Chess Rankings, becoming the first Sri Lankan player to reach the top spot in any global age category.

title: India frees up visas for Chinese professionals in key step to boost ties
byline: India has cut red tape to speed business visas for Chinese professionals, two officials said, a major step to boost ties between the Asian giants and end chronic delays that cost output worth billions of dollars because of scarce technicians.

title: Japan sets up mobile field hospital in Chilaw to aid flood victims
byline: Japan’s Disaster Relief Team (JDR) has established a fully equipped mobile field hospital at the Chilaw Police Grounds to provide urgent medical care to communities affected by recent flooding.

title: Continental Insurance CEO arrested
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has arrested the Chief Executive Officer of Continental Insurance Lanka Limited, Mailanarachchilage Don Wenceslaus Gerald Lazarus Gunadasa over allegations of bribery.

title: Former Speaker Ashoka Ranwala granted bail
byline: Former Speaker and NPP Parliamentarian Ashoka Ranwala, arrested in connection with a vehicular collision in Sapugaskanda on the night of December 11, has been granted bail.

title: EU set to indefinitely freeze Russian assets, removing obstacle to Ukraine loan
byline: The European Union looked set on Friday to indefinitely freeze Russian central bank assets held in Europe, removing a big obstacle to using the cash to help Ukraine defend itself against Moscow’s invasion.

title: Former Beliatta chairman arrested over alleged financial misconduct
byline: Former Beliatta Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman Cyril Munasinghe has been arrested in connection with an ongoing investigation into alleged financial irregularities during his tenure.

title: Minister calls for practical solutions to aid Meemure
byline: Minister K. D. Lal Kantha has urged the submission of scientific and practical proposals to improve access to areas affected by Cyclone Ditwah, with a particular focus on the remote Meemure region.

title: Psychiatrists issue mental health guidance after Cyclone Ditwah
byline: The Sri Lanka College of Psychiatrists has released a statement offering mental health support to people affected by Cyclone Ditwah, which caused severe disruption across the country.

title: Sri Lanka thanks China for support after Ditwah
byline: Foreign Affairs Minister Vijitha Herath met Yang Wanming, President of the Chinese People’s Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries, at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism today (12).

title: Meteorologists say cyclone alerts were issued on time
byline: The Sri Lanka Association of Meteorologists says officials of the Department of Meteorology followed proper Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) when issuing alerts ahead of Cyclone Ditwah, allowing fishing and naval communities to take early precautions and save lives.
